metadata.title: CVE-2023-3347 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
SMB2 packet signing not enforced

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3347` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
ldb-tools - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
libldb2 - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
libnss-winbind - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
libpam-winbind - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
libsmbclient - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
libwbclient0 - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
python3-ldb - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
python3-samba - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
registry-tools - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-common - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-common-bin - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-libs - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-testsuite - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
smbclient - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
winbind - 2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.16.8+dfsg-0ubuntu1.1').
